intro: Spergula australis, commonly known as the southern spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Spergula australis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
